837 [[kilohertz|kHz]] [[amplitude modulation|AM]] (Esperance)| |area = [[Goldfields-Esperance]] | |owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | |format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | |website = [http://www.abc.net.au/goldfields/ http://www.abc.net.au/goldfields/] | }} '''ABC Goldfields-Esperance''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Kalgoorlie, Western Australia|Kalgoorlie]]. The station broadcasts to the [[Goldfields-Esperance]] region of [[Western Australia]], including the towns of [[Esperance, Western Australia|Esperance]], [[Coolgardie, Western Australia|Coolgardie]], [[Kambalda, Western Australia|Kambalda]] and [[Norseman, Western Australia|Norseman]]. The station was formally opened by the then [[Electoral district of Kalgoorlie|State Member for Kalgoorlie]], [[Herbert Styants|Herbert Henry Styants]], on 10 December 1936. The station began broadcasting as '''6GF''' from the first floor of the Post Office building in [[Paddy Hannan|Hannan]] Street, Kalgoorlie. Later the station moved its studios to the [[Salvation Army]] Citadel, prior to moving to premises on the corner of Porter and Brookman Streets. The station is currently located at 353 Hannan Street. The transmitter at Esperance (callsign 6ED) was switched on in 1966. There are also a number of low power FM transmitters. When local programs are not broadcast the station is a relay of [[720 ABC Perth]]. ==References== {{cite web |title=The Birth of ABC Goldfields-Esperance |url=http://www.abc.net.au/local/stories/2008/03/11/2186140.htm|date=2008-03-11 |accessdate=2008-04-18 |publisher=[[ABC Online]] }} ==See also== * [[List of Australian radio stations]] {{ABC Local Radio}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Abc Goldfields-Esperance}} [[Category:Radio stations in Western Australia]]
